messages.message:
Hi Brian,

I'm reaching out to developers in the Valley. Currently have a perm opening in Tempe, AZ. Company is looking for a Ruby on Rails Developer and/or .NET or willing to get up to speed in one of them to take lead on this project. 

Look forward to connecting.

Brent
303-594-1614
Hi Brian- Great connecting on Linkedin. Would you be interested in chatting about this opportunity in Tempe?
I am so tired of working on other people's unexciting projects and bad code. What should I do?

Work for this client I have in Tempe. They are mobile golf app company w/ GPS and instruction functionality. Close to 4 million users and it's state of the art. When would you have some time to chat today?

Best,

Brent Stork
303-594-1614
Golf is the most boring sport. Do the ever get the feeling there is too much software?
Surprised you find it boring. Golf is a precision sport that takes great mental and physical skills and working at your craft to be excellent. Similar to creating exceptional software products! ;)
That's exactly what my dad said.
And I read that part in a Malcolm gladwell book where he talks about how technical one's form must be.

It's technical and artistic at the same time where you can be very creative in coming up w/ various shots and visualizing it. Best of both worlds! So you wanna write some Rails code for these guys in Tempe?
